meanings.definition: The state of being idle or unoccupied.
meanings.sent1: His otioseness during the weekend was evident as he lounged on the couch all day.
meanings.sent2: The otioseness of the park on a rainy day made it a perfect spot for solitude.
meanings.sent3: The cat's otioseness in front of the fireplace was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The otioseness of the abandoned factory echoed the town's economic downturn.
meanings.sent5: The otioseness of the student during class was a stark reminder of his lack of interest.

meanings.definition: The quality of being unproductive or useless.
meanings.sent1: The otioseness of the old computer was evident as it struggled to load any programs.
meanings.sent2: The otioseness of the broken tool rendered it useless for any repairs.
meanings.sent3: The otioseness of the broken umbrella was comical as it flipped inside out in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The otioseness of the expired coupon was a reminder of missed savings opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The otioseness of the rusty key made it impossible to unlock the door.
